citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The required acquisition and disposition records and were not available for review and examination by the APHIS officials
for this inspection.
During the inspection, the facility representative’s husband stated there were no animals at the site for this registration.
There were records available for review, but the facility representative didn’t know how to access them, stating his wife
oversees records management. The facility representative stated their wife would return to the facility today and would be
able to email the records to APHIS officials. APHIS officials also attempted to contact the second facility representative
during the inspection via phone, but did not hear back. Another attempt was made via email, requesting the required
records by Friday, December 12th, 2025 to complete the remainder of the inspection. Some records were submitted, but
subsequent acquisition and disposition records were not provided by the registrant until three days after the required date
of submission. These records conflicted the information provided to APHIS officials during the inspection regarding the
acquisition of twelve sugar gliders. No disposition records for these animals were provided.
Review of paperwork at a facility ensures they are operating as intended to ensure the welfare of the animals used and
housed by the facility, as well as animals transported or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control in
regulated activities. The facility shall ensure that records required by the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and the regulations
are available for APHIS officials to review on all inspections.
Correct by December 18, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The required acquisition and disposition records and were not available for review and examination by the APHIS officials 
for this inspection. 
 
During the inspection, the facility representative’s husband stated there were no animals at the site for this registration. 
There were records available for review, but the facility representative didn’t know how to access them, stating his wife 
oversees records management. The facility representative stated their wife would return to the facility today and would be 
able to email the records to APHIS officials. APHIS officials also attempted to contact the second facility representative 
during the inspection via phone, but did not hear back. Another attempt was made via email, requesting the required 
records by Friday, December 12th, 2025 to complete the remainder of the inspection. Some records were submitted, but 
subsequent acquisition and disposition records were not provided by the registrant until three days after the required date 
of submission. These records conflicted the information provided to APHIS officials during the inspection regarding the 
acquisition of twelve sugar gliders. No disposition records for these animals were provided.  
 
Review of paperwork at a facility ensures they are operating as intended to ensure the welfare of the animals used and 
housed by the facility, as well as animals transported or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control in 
regulated activities. The facility shall ensure that records required by the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and the regulations 
are available for APHIS officials to review on all inspections. 
 
Correct by December 18, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Patricia Laracuente, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
